title: Family Law Simulation-Based Teacher Competency Enhancement Program

context.prior_knowledge: Basic legal terminology and fundamental understanding of educational settings
context.additional_context: A program for prospective and in-service teachers to cultivate conflict-resolution skills in educational settings through family law case studies.

learning_goals: Learners can identify key legal issues with 80% accuracy after role-playing in three family law simulations (mediated divorce, child custody mediation, and marriage contract review).
Learners can propose at least two conflict-resolution strategies applicable to educational settings through feedback sessions post-simulation.
Learners can achieve over 4 points (on a 5-point scale) on role-play evaluation rubrics by applying ethical communication techniques during mock client counseling.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
